item.title: Alleyway blocked by tree cut down from 93 Lyndon Avenue, 30th August
item.description:
Tree previously growing within 93 Lyndon Avenue property has been cut down and is blocking my emergency exit route from the rear of my propery. Also fence panels dumped in the alleyway. First noticed on 28-Aug-25, but allowed the offender a bit of time to remove his rubbish. He did something similar a few years ago,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Lyndon Avenue, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 16 kenilworth road, 30th August
item.description:
The tree on the pavement has been removed. They have left a big hole and an unstable plastic fence that has already collapsed on the pavement. This has been the case since Wednesday 27/8

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London

item.title: Overgrown sharp branches, 30th August
item.description:
Outside 36 Cromwell Road, Long sharp branches growing at the base of the tree are scraping cars. Also, rubbish keeps being thrown into them. Could they please be removed? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cromwell Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle bay wrongly proposed outside 2 Meynell Crescent, 30th August
item.description:
Works begin on Monday to install a dockless cycle hire bay outside 2 Meynell Crescent, E9 under Traffic Order TT1763. But the statutory notices (Gazette 7 March & 25 July 2025) describe the location as Meynell Road. Please suspend and review urgently
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Meynell Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of clothing and bedding, all over pavement, 30th August
item.description:
The pictured bags of clothing and bedding have been strewn about the pavement for weeks now. The rain has caused a rancid smell to emit from the area and it is getting a bit out of hand.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Way, Camberwell, London

item.title: Parking signs sprayed with black paint in residents parking Pellerin Road, 30th August
item.description:
Parking signs sprayed with black paint in residents parking Pellerin Road For Shellgrove Estste residents. Residents unable to use paid for parking due to non residents taking up spaces due to the sprayed/blacked out parking signs . (As of Saturday Aug 30)
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree down, 30th August
item.description:
On Hammond street, near the planters in the road, a young tree is down, leaning across path, resting on property wall, and totally blocking the path. Looks like it has been vandalised. (I tried to leave this feedback under the 'trees option' but was asking me to select a yellow dot on the map; but there is no corresponding yellow dot on the map in the position of where the tree is?!)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Wolsey Mews, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lyme terrace, 30th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lyme Terrace, Kentish Town, London

item.title: Pot Hole (deep and wide), 30th August
item.description:
Horrendous pothole that is quite deep and about a foot wide. Right in front of my driveway so it gets my car wheel every single time. It’s been there many months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coniston Close, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Reported for the 3RD TIME still NOT PICKED UP, SOFA ON COUNCIL LAND OUTSIDE 264 WELL HALL ROAD, LEADING TO VERMIN PROBLEM, I WILL CONTACT THE MP IF GREENWICH COUNCIL CONTINUE TO IGNORE THIS, IT HAS NOW BEEN MONTHS, PEOPLE ARE LOOSING HOUSE SALES BECAUSE OF THIS, 30th August
item.description:
Reported for the 3RD TIME still NOT PICKED UP, SOFA ON COUNCIL LAND OUTSIDE 264 WELL HALL ROAD, LEADING TO VERMIN PROBLEM, I WILL CONTACT THE MP IF GREENWICH COUNCIL CONTINUE TO IGNORE THIS, IT HAS NOW BEEN MONTHS, PEOPLE ARE LOOSING HOUSE SALES BECAUSE OF THIS, NEXT STEP SOCIAL MEDIA COMPLAINTS REGARDING LOST HOUSE SALES IN THE AREA BECAUSE GREENWICH COUNCIL REFUSE TO CLEAR A SOFA ON THEIR LAND

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Well Hall Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why are Greenwich Council Refusing to collect a sofa on their land outside residential houses - THIS IS THE 3RD TIME OF HAVING TO REPORT THIS - IT HAS BEEN 2 MONTHS SINCE FIRST REPORTING IT, THIS IS A HEALTH HAZARD FOR VERMIN AND MICE, DO YOUR JOB AND CLEAR IT , NEXT STEP I WILL CONTACT THE LOCAL MP, 30th August
item.description:
